title: Seniors living in Bangalore, how do you commute to RR campus?
content:
Where do you live, how do you commute, commute time?  
  
Eg: Indira Nagar - Public Bus/PES Bus/Metro/Bike - 1 hour per side

Please feel free to elaborate about your commute experience. i.e. Pros and Cons or things to keep in mind.  
  
This will help freshers to plan better.

comments.body: Indiranagar metro station to Mysore road metro station. And then you can board the bus till college

Does Metro offer pass for students? 

By bus from metro station you mean PES Bus? How frequently they run bus from metro station or to metro station?

pes bus only   
ig you can hop on any college bus passing by
no you can hop on the pes bus as well
RR Nagar - Bike - 10 mins per side
How much does pesu bus facility cost?
Check the website its different for different routes and the length of the route you are travelling
Vijayanagar, 15 minutes commute each way through scooter. Roughly 7 km.
PES RR do provide bus facilities if you want. Other routes are public transport or driving.

I am new to Bangalore. I will be staying with my cousin in Whitefield and planning to take metro from there to Mysore road.

Can you tell me   
a) Name of the BMTC bus stop near Mysore road metro station  
b) Name of the BMTC stop near PES University  
c) Couple of BMTC routes that goes to and fro from Mysore road metro station and PES University  
d) How much is the fare?
